data.title: Domestic Dishes: Miami Man’s Love Triangle Turns Violent in the Kitchen
data.meta_description: Love can be a battlefield, but for Thaddeus Davis, it seems like the kitchen is where the real action unfolds. This Miami man recently made headlines, not for
data.text:
Love can be a battlefield, but for Thaddeus Davis, it seems like the kitchen is where the real action unfolds. This Miami man recently made headlines, not for whipping up a gourmet meal, but for using cooking utensils in a way that would make any chef cringe.

According to FOX35, in a heated argument, Davis and his girlfriend engaged in a verbal sparring match that quickly escalated. The catalyst? Text messages on her phone. Davis, clearly in need of some relationship counseling, demanded to see the elusive messages, but his girlfriend was having none of it. And that’s when things got interesting.

Enter the cooking pan—a multitasking tool that most of us use for whipping up breakfast or searing a steak. For Davis, it became a makeshift weapon as he decided to give his girlfriend’s noggin a hearty whack. But Thaddeus wasn’t finished. He upgraded to a kitchen knife, transforming the cooking arena into a full-fledged combat zone. A stab to the left side added a touch of culinary horror to this domestic dispute.

Next our ‘culinary criminal,’ Davis, armed with his newfound trophy… A stolen phone, made a swift exit leaving his victim with a story to tell the cops. Thankfully, she made a call of her own. The police.

Fast forward to November 1, and Davis apparently decided that one kitchen showdown wasn’t enough. This time, it was a punch to the mouth during an argument with another woman, who may or may not be the previous victim. It seems like Davis has a thing for turning domestic disputes into an episode of “Kitchen Nightmares.”

Thankfully Thaddeus Davis now finds himself behind bars, proving once again that when it comes to relationships, the kitchen is best left for cooking, not for cooking up trouble.

How To Get Tickets To See Taylor Swift Eras Tour In Miami

The Taylor Swift Eras Tour announced new US dates and Miami is among them. Friday – Sunday | October 18 – 20, 2024. Remember back in April when all your Fort Myers and Naples friends posted pics from the show in Tampa? Well, this time it’s going to be you. I’ve got some tips that will help you secure tickets to see Taylor Swift in Miami.

So, last time ticket went on sale Ticketmaster totally made a mess of things. A lot of people missed out on tickets because of that. Whole lotta crying videos on Tik Tok. I get it, this show is a big deal. We can’t let that happen again. So here are several things you can do to make sure you’re at one of those Miami shows in October next year. (One of the ways includes free tickets. I’ll get to that.)

Verified Fan

This is Ticketmaster’s ‘fix’. You can register for verified fan tickets up until August 5th at 5pm. Then, on August 8th you’ll find out if you won the lottery. You’ll either get to buy tickets or be placed on a waitlist. If you’re selected, you get a code and a time window of when you’ll be able to buy tickets. Make sure before you get to that time window that you have already entered your credit card info into your Ticketmaster account. Even with the code you aren’t guaranteed to get tickets, and those precious seconds it takes to enter in your card info could be the make or break. Here’s the link to sign in as a Verified Fan. If you don’t already have a Ticketmaster account, you’ll need to do that first.

VIP Verified Fan and any presales have not been announced yet for the Taylor Swift Eras Tour In Miami.

If there’s a lot of you that want to go, one overlooked way of scoring a block of tickets is to buy a suite at the stadium. Now, when you see the price it may seem like a lot. But when you divide it up it’s still a whole lot better than buying the tickets from the resellers. Plus, why not? Fill out the form and see what happens.

To receive priority access to purchase available Suites or Luxury Seating, please fill out this form.

Dedication is going to be key to getting these tickets without paying thousands to a scalper. We don’t want that. So here’s more tips. The ticket-buying experts at TicketSource have revealed their 5 insider tips on how to give yourself the best chance at securing those all-important tickets…

Meet Budman, dynamic host of Marconi Award winning radio station WXKB's WiLD Bunch Morning Show, on B1039. Budman likes to write about funny news, a good Florida man story, stupid criminals or anything involving a superhero. Budman, a comic book and pop culture enthusiast, even named his daughter Kara Zor-El, after Supergirl. His only child is his true passion beyond the mic. Being a dad is his favorite role. Budman, a true family man, balances his love for radio with quality time spent with loved ones and his trusty dogs.
